actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to prohibit States from denying unemployment compensation to individuals who are unavailable for work because of temporary illnesses.

summary.text: Prohibits States, under provisions of the Internal Revenue Code relating to requirements for approval of State unemployment compensation laws, from denying unemployment compensation to individuals who are unavailable for work because of illnesses lasting or expected to last not more than 14 days and which has been verified by a physician.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to prohibit States from denying unemployment compensation to individuals who are unavailable for work because of temporary illnesses.
